channel.title: Need help with shops!
channel.description: Hey guys, I want to make a custom shop from scratch. For example i'm getting a npc and clicking "Trade ShopKeeper" but nothing opens. Can anyone tell me how to make it open a interface so I can add items? <-- I know how to add items to shops :P I use deathlypvpz v4 (317)

item.dc:creator: @tgm_clan tgm clan

I did, don’t worry about it, thanks sk8er for trying,

item.title: Need help with shops!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“str0ngscap3, post:18, topic:520845”]does it crash after you click trade?

if not search for wanneshop =
after the } add else if (NPCID == NPCID HERE) { // shop PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = SHOPID HERE; // shop }

if it does crash try moving the npc in autospawn somewhere in the middle of the script[/quote]
wanneshop isn’t in PI.
Your code isn’t relevant.

[quote=“tgm clan, post:17, topic:520845”]I don’t think there is… I can’t find one below 100 that isn’t taken

EDIT- I deleted a shop to add mine and now, when i trade him the shop won’t open[/quote]

Remember. The shop Id needs to be the same in this part of your code:
c.getShops().openShop(1);

Read full topic

EDIT- I deleted a shop to add mine and now, when i trade him the shop won’t open[/quote]
does it crash after you click trade?

if not search for wanneshop =
after the } add else if (NPCID == NPCID HERE) { // shop PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = SHOPID HERE; // shop }

if it does crash try moving the npc in autospawn somewhere in the middle of the script

item.title: Need help with shops!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

in actionhandler.java find:

public void secondClickNpc(final int npcType) {

There should be a switch:

switch (npcType) {

You need to add the NPC ID in as the case. I’ll use Hans (ID 0) as an example:

case 0:
//Your code will go here
break;

Keep that open, we’ll get back to it.
In your data > cfg folder, you should have shops.cfg. Open it.
You need to add a new line in there, but be careful. If you add it wrong it won’t work.

shop = 39	SHOP_NAME	2	2	5343	100

You’re going to want to use that as an example. If you copy and paste it’ll break.
between the 39 and SHOP_NAME is a tab. Each section after that has a tab. shop = 39 doesn’t have tabs, it has spaces.
the 39 is the shop ID. You’re going to want to use an ID that isn’t already take in the cfp.
5343 is the item in the shop 100 is the quantity.
The two 2’s… Idk what they do. So lol.
Now that you have your shop added in, lets go back to your action handler.

replace “//Your code here” with:

c.getShops().openShop(1);

But change the 1 to your shop ID.

That should cover everything, unless you wanted to use a token of some sort as the cash.

Save & compile. Then test it.
Post errors

Read full topic
